programme.title: 2024 NBA All-Star Celebrity Game
programme.desc: Celebrities from film, TV, and music, along with favorite NBA legends and WNBA players, test their skills for a fun and entertaining basketball game in the NBA All-Star Celebrity Game. From Indianapolis.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: From Madison Square Garden in New York.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. The primary host is Rece Davis, joined by analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis. The show typically originates from the site of one of the day's biggest games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Aggies (15-9, 6-5 SEC) mount a challenge against the No. 15 Crimson Tide (17-7, 9-2). Alabama halted a five-game slide in its series against Texas A&M by taking an 82-63 decision in the championship game of the 2023 SEC Tournament.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Seminoles (13-11, 7-6 ACC) host the No. 9 Blue Devils (19-5, 10-3). Duke has taken 11 of the last 13 versus Florida State, but both FSU victories came at home. Mark Mitchell's 17.7 points per game is pacing Duke over its three-match win streak.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The chastened No. 6 Jayhawks (19-6, 7-5 Big 12) face the No. 25 Sooners (18-7, 6-6). Kansas comes off a 79-50 drubbing at the hands of Texas Tech on Feb. 12. Hunter Dickinson's 24-point double-double pushed Kansas past Oklahoma 78-66 on Jan. 13.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 13 Tigers (20-5, 9-3) host the No. 22 Wildcats (17-7, 7-4) in SEC action. The schools split their last six matchups with the home team prevailing in each. Auburn has won four of five after bullying No. 11 South Carolina 101-61 on Feb. 14.

programme.title: UFC 298: Volkanovski vs. Topuria - Prelims
programme.desc: Zhang Mingyang vs. Brendson Ribeiro, light heavyweight; Rinya Nakamura vs. Carlos Vera, bantamweight; Marcos Rogerio de Lima vs. Justin Tafa, heavyweight; Amanda Lemos vs. Mackenzie Dern; strawweight. From Honda Center in Anaheim, Calif.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Buffaloes finish up duty in Los Angeles when they complete their season series versus the Trojans. On Jan. 13, Colorado beat USC for the first time in four tries, 68-58. Colorado senior J'Vonne Hadley led the way with 15 points and nine rebounds.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Devils and Flyers kick off the 2024 Stadium Series at MetLife Stadium. Philadelphia is 1-1-0 in Stadium Series games, both against in-state rival Pittsburgh. In its only date, New Jersey lost to the New York Rangers at Yankee Stadium in 2014.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Rams (16-8, 8-3 A-10) visit the Billikens (9-15, 2-9). VCU handed Dayton a second straight loss in Richmond, Va., as it held the Flyers to 36.2% shooting in a 49-47 win Feb. 9. Joe Bamisile's 29 points put VCU over Saint Louis 85-61 on Jan. 19.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: From Eddie C. Moore Complex in Clearwater, Fla.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Exclusive takes on the biggest news, stars, and stories from UFC.

programme.title: UFC Ultimate Knockouts
programme.desc: Memorable knock-outs from throughout MMA history.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 21 Cavaliers (19-6, 10-4 ACC) try to regroup as they host the Demon Deacons (16-8, 8-5). Virginia's eight-game win streak ended in a 74-63 loss to Pittsburgh on Feb. 13. Hunter Sallis' 21 points led Wake Forest past Virginia 66-47 on Jan. 13.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Panthers (11-16, 6-8 CIAA) tip off against the Rams (16-8, 10-5) in the third annual NBA HBCU Classic from Gainbridge Fieldhouse in Indianapolis. This All-Star weekend showcase has previously been won by Howard and Grambling State.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Longhorns (23-3, 10-3 Big 12) aim for a statement against the Cyclones (14-9, 8-5). Iowa State knocked off Texas in the 2023 Big 12 Tournament final, 61-51. Madison Booker (TEX) is averaging 21.4 points per game over her last five outings.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Mountaineers (8-16, 3-8 Big 12) are in tough against the No. 12 Bears (18-6, 7-4). Baylor has won five in a row over West Virginia, but dropped three of its last four on the road in 2023-24. Quinn Slazinski (WVU) averages 13 points per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Yale and Princeton face a quick turnaround when they take the court at the Jadwin Gymnasium. The Bulldogs are 4-1 against the Tigers since the 2022 conference tournament following a 70-64 verdict Feb. 2. Yale's Danny Wolf double-doubled in the win.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Oilers are in tough when they skate with the Stars in Texas. On Nov. 2, 2023, Joe Pavelski and Roope Hintz had three points apiece as Dallas edged past Edmonton 4-3. Hintz owns a team-high 13 goals at home this season, where his Stars are 17-8-2.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: The 2024 NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series begins with the Fresh From Florida 250. Last season's champion Ben Rhodes returns in the 99 truck for ThorSport Racing, and starts another quest to be the first back-to-back champ since Matt Crafton in 2013-14.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Lobos seek their first season-series sweep of the Aztecs since the 2016-17 campaign. New Mexico welcomed San Diego State to the Pit on Jan. 13 and handed the then-No. 19 Aztecs an 88-70 loss. Jaelen House (UNM) scored 26 points in the victory.

programme.title: ARCA Racing Series
programme.desc: From Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: The 2024 NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series begins with the Fresh From Florida 250. Last season's champion Ben Rhodes returns in the 99 truck for ThorSport Racing, and starts another quest to be the first back-to-back champ since Matt Crafton in 2013-14.

programme.title: I Am Kevin Harvick
programme.desc: The film chronicles legendary NASCAR champion and FOX Sports' newest NASCAR analyst Kevin Harvick, through his exhilarating racing career and beyond the finish line to unveil the story behind the iconic athlete.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: The 2024 NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series begins with the Fresh From Florida 250. Last season's champion Ben Rhodes returns in the 99 truck for ThorSport Racing, and starts another quest to be the first back-to-back champ since Matt Crafton in 2013-14.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub Weekend Edition

programme.title: ARCA Racing Series
programme.desc: From Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Relive Dale Earnhardt's first and only victory in the Daytona 500 as NASCAR celebrated its 50th anniversary season. From Feb. 15, 1998.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay - NXS
programme.desc: Prerace with up-to-the-minute reports from the garage prior to the start of each NASCAR Xfinity Series race.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: The 2024 NASCAR Xfinity Series gets going with the United Rentals 300 in Florida. Cole Custer returns for Stewart-Haas Racing in the double-zero car after capturing the season-long championship in 2023. Austin Hill won this race in 2022 and 2023.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The NCAA Tournament-hopeful Friars host the Blue Demons for a Big East game. Providence has won five straight meetings after a 100-62 decision in January. Friars senior Josh Oduro is averaging 16.4 points per game after totaling 60 in his last two.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Copper State foes meet in the No. 5 Wildcats (19-5, 10-3 Pac-12) and Sun Devils (13-12, 7-7). Arizona has won five in a row overall, and six of the last seven meetings with Arizona State after a 78-59 triumph in a 2023 Pac-12 Tournament semifinal.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Rebels face a fierce Mountain West rival in the Wolf Pack. UNLV has won four straight meetings after taking a pair in 2022-23 by a combined eight points. Sophomore forward Nick Davidson (NEV) has averaged 20 points over his last four games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Huskies host the No. 4 Golden Eagles in a marquee matinee. The schools last met in the 2023 Big East Tournament semifinals, when Marquette prevailed 70-68. Defending national champion UConn is 13-0 at home this season, 7-0 in Hartford.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 14 Fighting Illini seek revenge against the Terrapins. Illinois, a winner of four of its last five, fell to Maryland 76-67 on Jan. 14 despite Marcus Domask's 26 points. The victory was Maryland's 10th in the last 12 tries versus Illinois.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Wildcats (17-8, 8-6 Big Ten) try to bring an end to their road woes as they visit the Hoosiers (14-10, 6-7). Northwestern won two 2022-23 meetings with Indiana by a combined three points. The Wildcats have dropped five straight away from home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Pirates (16-9, 9-5 Big East) seek a fourth straight win over the Red Storm (14-11, 6-8). Seton Hall defeated St. John's 80-65 in January behind 16 points and 10 rebounds by former Red Storm guard Dylan Addae-Wusu and 21 points from Al-Amir Dawes.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Bruins aim to avenge a historic loss to the Utes in Los Angeles. On Jan. 11, Utah annihilated UCLA 90-44 for the second-most lopsided loss in Bruins' history, only eclipsed by a 109-61 drubbing Stanford handed UCLA on Jan. 9, 1997.

programme.title: 2024 Daytona 500
programme.desc: The rubber hits the road for the 2024 NASCAR Cup Series season with the running of the Daytona 500. Last year, Ricky Stenhouse Jr. picked up his first victory since 2017 in a caution-filled race that ended with a crash after two overtime restarts.
